critique: This executive order primarily deals with the transfer of background investigation responsibilities from the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) to the Department of Defense (DoD). It's largely an administrative and organizational restructuring. There's no immediately obvious ideological tilt, immigration impact, or effect on civil liberties. It centralizes power within the federal government, specifically within the DoD, so it leans towards federal primacy. It doesn't seem to directly address economic regulation or social inclusion. Therefore, most axes should be close to neutral, with a slight lean towards federal control.
